Intervention.evidence: vein bypass (VB) first versus a best endovascular treatment (BET) first revascularization strategy

Objective.evidence: The objective of this health economic analysis was to investigate the cost-effectiveness (CEA) and cost-utility (CUA)

Method_Outcome.evidence: incremental cost-effectiveness ratios expressed as cost per amputation-free life year (AFLY) and cost per quality-adjusted life year (QALY)

Result_Outcome.evidence: The lower costs (–£2524.23, 95% c.i., –£5844.93 to £1131.52) in the BET-first group were mainly due to the reduced number of days in hospital and lower procedural costs. BET-first was also more effective leading to additional AFLYs (0.429, 95% c.i., 0.03 to 0.88) at 7 years and discounted QALYs (0.016, 95% c.i., −0.08 to 0.12) at 2 years.
